info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 30 at 10:01AM MDT until July 31 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible.
* WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast New Mexico, including the following areas, in east central New Mexico, De Baca County, Guadalupe County and Quay County. In northeast New Mexico, Eastern San Miguel County.
* WHEN...Through late tonight.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms will develop this afternoon and tonight as a moist backdoor front crosses with rich monsoon moisture and a disturbance in the flow aloft. Some thunderstorms will be capable of producing torrential rainfall at rates potentially over 2 inches per hour. Urban areas and locations where the ground is already saturated from recent rainfall will be especially susceptible to rapid runoff and flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County; Quay County; De Baca County
